citeinfo.title: Effect of Mesoscale Anticyclonic Eddies on the Hydrochemical Structure of the Bering Sea

descript.abstract: The paper presents data showing the effect of mesoscale eddies on the distribution of phosphates, nitrates, ammonia nitrogen, organic phosphorus and nitrogen in the Bering Sea. An important role is played by powerful anticyclonic eddies along the edge of the continental slope. Water 'slips' over the slope sometimes down to depths of 600-1000 m and reaches the oxygen minimum layer. Under these conditions renewal of water in the oxygen minimum layer and upwelling of deep water in the adjacent cyclonic eddies take place. The new data call for revision of earlier ideas on the rate of vertical surface, intermediate and deep water exchange.
descript.purpose: To show the effect of mesoscale anticyclonic eddies on the hydrochemical structure of the Bering Sea.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
